BUCS Cup heartbreak for hockey seconds as Sheffield squeeze through

A late Sheffield double turned this BUCS Cup second round encounter on its head, after Sammi Spencer's goal put York in the box seat (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Women's rugby smash past Leeds Trinity for first league win

A number of superb individual performances gave York a 71-0 win against Leeds Trinity on Wednesday, collecting their first points of the BUCS season (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Football fourths collect first points of the season

An 80th-minute penalty by Angus O'Brien was enough to give UYAFC fourths all three points against determined Bradford last Wednesday

Wentworth hit for six as Langwith find top gear

Bruce Starkey's first-half hat-trick was central to Langwith's 6-0 romp over Wentworth on matchday three of the College Football today (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Five star Halifax continue Vanbrugh's College Football misery

Jack Beadle's hat-trick was at the centre of another comprehensive Halifax win, which kept them in touch with the pace-setters in the College Football league (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Alcuin overcome James to climb to College Football summit

Udy Onwudike's fortuitous late goal gave Alcuin a 3-2 victory over James on Matchday three of the College Football League (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Goodricke come from behind to topple Derwent off the top

Goals from Ben Smith and Eddie Silson flipped this exciting contest on its head as Goodricke knocked Derwent off College Football's top spot (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Football's heritage is being corroded by selfish commercialisation

Shameless money-spinning techniques, such as selling stadium naming rights to corporations, are draining away what is left of tradition in football, argues Jake Farrell (Thumbnail credit Mike Ashley, the Newcastle United owner, has renamed his club's spiritual home the sportsdirect@ St James Park Stadium to reactions of bemusement and anger from supporters)

VIDEO - Wednesday Round-up: November 11th

There were successes for the football, rugby, netball, basketball, hockey and volleyball teams in a hectic afternoon of sport. Includes the York Sport Show. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Women's Basketball give Hallam attacking masterclass

York's 136-10 BUCS League victory over Sheffield Hallam seconds was probably the easiest game they will ever play (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Netball firsts hold off Sunderland challenge for first league win

York held their nerve to beat Sunderland 29-23 yesterday, picking up their first BUCS League points in the process (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Football firsts show title credentials with Teesside rout

Two goals apiece for Connor Brennan and Chris Barnett, plus strikes from Ian McKellow, Alex Tringham and Joe Brennan gave York a 7-1 victory over Teesside yesterday (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Manchester victory makes it four out of five for men's rugby

A 36-15 victory over Manchester seconds once again demonstrated that the rugby firsts can mix it with the best in Northern Conference 1A (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)

Women's hockey rue missed chances as Newcastle gain draw

York's Emily Lucas saw her first-half opener cancelled out by Laura Mason as visiting Newcastle picked up a point on the Astroturf (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Honours even as Goodricke salvage point against Alcuin

Dave Coupland's late strike gave Goodricke a deserved share of the spoils against Alcuin on matchday two of the College Football League (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Special Feature: A week in the life of a rower

Is it possible to maintain and social life, a good degree and a sport as intense as rowing? Becca Robinson, of the University Boat Club, says it is. (Thumbnail credit Successes like this one at Roses 2009 make all the training worthwhile. Photograph by George Lowther)

Special Feature: Yorkshire's Ironman

By James Bithell

George Georgallides interviews York-based Philip Graves, who, at the age of just 20 is the defending UK Iron Man champion

Accusations of unfair allocations as York Sport budget row continues

Criticism has been aimed at York Sport by clubs following revelations of inconsistencies in the amount teams have seen their annual grant altered by this year.

The strange death of university sport: Archery

A lot has changed for sport at the University of York in the past couple of years, and not all of it has been for the better. The recent massive budget cuts are just one part of this. (Thumbnail credit Action from the Roses tournament in 2008. Even at university standard, Archery is an equipment-intensive sport. Photograph by George Lowther)

The University of York Polo Club

In delightful contrast to the usual stereotypes about the sport, Sports Editor Adam Shergold finds a warm, all-inclusive and pioneering club. Exclusive photographs by Irene Sieberger. (Thumbnail credit Club President Sarah Freites with 'Humereda')

Emily Scott - York Sport President

We're into week five of term and the York Sport budget has been under scrutiny from the campus press for five weeks.

College Notebook: James vs Collingwood

In a busy day of sport, James College hosted Collingwood, from the University of Durham. Sports Editor Adam Shergold rounds up the action. (Thumbnail credit Huw Harrow heads goalwards during the hard-fought football encounter, which Collingwood won 3-1. Photograph: Justyn Hardcastle)

All sports clubs are created equal, some are just more equal than others

While the Caving and Pothole Club only have sufficient ropage to negotiate their way into the underground kingdom, and the skydiivng club are being forced to cut down on parachute provision, the Royal York University Squash Society are raking in the readies.

Derwent hit Langwith for six to move top of College football league standings

Derwent moved to the top of the College Football League table with a thumping 6-1 win over Langwith in the second round of fixtures this weekend. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Wentworth battle back to hold misfiring Vanbrugh

Matt Glover's well-taken goal cancelled out Phil Taylor's first-half opener as Wentworth and Vanbrugh shared the spoils on college matchday two (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

York City too powerful for women's football seconds

The fresh-faced line-up of the women's football second XI were handed a footballing lesson by rampant York City on Sunday

Derwent rout Langwith to reach College Football summit

Four-goal Chris Barnett was the inspiration behind Derwent's 6-1 drubbing of Langwith, as they went top of the College Football standings (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Little to separate Halifax and James in Sunday's College Football

In matchday two of the College Football league, James and Halifax fought out a 1-1 draw on the 22 Acres. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Alcuin's first-half blitz too much for Vanbrugh

In a genuine game of two halves, Alcuin moved to the summit of the Emperor College Rugby league with a 36-12 win over Vanbrugh

Drab affair sees Collingwood take the honours

In the centrepiece of Saturday's James-Collingwood sports day, the Durham outfit's football side ran out 3-1 winners against a makeshift James team (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)
